extendedIngredients.name: lobster tail
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 ounces lobster tail, cleaned and chopped

recipes.title: Lobster Colorado

winePairing.pairingText: Chablis and Chardonnay are my top picks for Lobster. Chablis is perfect with lobster, but a chardonny from other regions is bound to hit the spot too. One wine you could try is Louis Jadot Chablis. It has 4.4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 20 dollars.

productMatches.title: Louis Jadot Chablis
productMatches.description: The Louis Jadot Chablis has a very nice golden yellow color. It is a lipid, bright and fresh wine, which taste and bouquet develop relatively quickly.It should be served chilled, and can be served with oysters, charcuterie and fried fish. It also goes very well with goats cheese.

recipes.instructions: Set oven to Broil at 500 degrees F (260 degrees C).                            Sprinkle tenderloins all over with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.  Wrap each filet with bacon, and secure with a toothpick.  Place on a broiling pan, and broil to desired doneness, about 8 to 10 minutes per side for medium rare.                            While tenderloins are cooking, melt 1/4 cup of butter over medium heat with 1/2 teaspoon Old Bay® seasoning.  Stir in chopped lobster meat, and cook until done.  Spoon lobster meat over cooked tenderloins, and return them to the broiler until the lobster meat begins to brown.                            While the lobster is in the oven, heat the remaining 1/4 cup of butter in a small saucepan over medium-high heat, cook until it browns, turning the color of a hazelnut.  To serve, spoon the browned butter over the steaks, and sprinkle with the remaining Old Bay® seasoning.                                                Kitchen-Friendly View

steps.step: Set oven to Broil at 500 degrees F (260 degrees C).
Sprinkle tenderloins all over with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.  Wrap each filet with bacon, and secure with a toothpick.
Place on a broiling pan, and broil to desired doneness, about 8 to 10 minutes per side for medium rare.

While tenderloins are cooking, melt 1/4 cup of butter over medium heat with 1/2 teaspoon Old Bay® seasoning.  Stir in chopped lobster meat, and cook until done.  Spoon lobster meat over cooked tenderloins, and return them to the broiler until the lobster meat begins to brown.

While the lobster is in the oven, heat the remaining 1/4 cup of butter in a small saucepan over medium-high heat, cook until it browns, turning the color of a hazelnut.  To serve, spoon the browned butter over the steaks, and sprinkle with the remaining Old Bay® seasoning.
